BROKEN DOWN.Definition: to separate, or to separate something, into smaller parts

LATE.Definition: used to refer to someone who has died

LEGENDARY.Definition: very famous and admired or spoken about

ROLLIN' 60S CRIP.Definition: a street gang based in Los Angeles, California, originally formed in Los Angeles in 1976 from the Westside Crips and have since spread to other cities in the United States

MIXTAPE.Definition: a collection of songs put together for a particular person or occasion but not professionally produced, especially on a cassette (= a flat rectangular device containing a very long strip of magnetic material for recording sound)

BUMPING.Definition: to be playing or listening to music really loud

ANALYZE.Definition: to study or examine something in detail in order to discover or understand more about it

SLANG.Definition: very informal language that is usually spoken rather than written, used especially by particular groups of people

NIGGA.Definition: a way of saying or writing nigger (= an extremely offensive word for a black person)

BRAINWASHED.Definition: to make someone believe something by repeatedly telling him or her that it is true and preventing any other information from reaching him or her

I DON'T GIVE A FUCK.Definition: an extremely offensive expression used for emphasizing that you do not care at all about someone or something

VULGAR.Definition: rude and likely to upset or anger people, especially by referring to sex and the body in an unpleasant way

TURNED UP.Definition: to increase the amount of sound, heat, or light produced by a piece of equipment by pressing a button or moving a switch

VENT.Definition: a small opening that allows air, smoke, or gas to enter or leave a closed space

GANG.Definition: a group of young people, especially young men, who spend time together, often fighting with other groups and behaving badly

SYNONYMOUS WITH.Definition: if you say that one thing is synonymous with another, you mean that the two things are so closely connected in most people's minds that one suggests the other

RIVALS.Definition: a person, group, etc. competing with others for the same thing or in the same area

CODE.Definition: a set of rules that are accepted as general principles, or a set of written rules that say how people in a particular organization or country should behave

COWARD.Definition: a person who is not brave and is too eager to avoid danger, difficulty, or pain

HUSTLE.Definition: to make strenuous efforts to obtain especially money or business

WHITE.Definition: active, determined, and often willing to use force

HOWLING.Definition: to make a loud sound, usually to express pain, sadness, or another strong emotion

POETIC.Definition: like or relating to poetry or poets

ILLUSTRATIVE.Definition: helping to explain or prove something

HEARTLESS.Definition: cruel and not worrying about other people

EMPATHY.Definition: the ability to share someone else's feelings or experiences by imagining what it would be like to be in that person's situation

FEND FOR YOURSELF.Definition: to take care of and provide for yourself without depending on anyone else

MENTALITY.Definition: a person's particular way of thinking about things

DOPE.Definition: marijuana, or, more generally, any type of illegal drug

REMINISCE.Definition: to think about or tell of past experiences or events

HOMIES.Definition: a slang term for a close friend

SUCKER.Definition: a person easily cheated or deceived

PUNK.Definition: a young person who fights and is involved in criminal activities

CERTIFIED.Definition: approved by an official organization to do a particular job because you have successfully completed its examination and proved that you have the necessary training and qualifications

TAKE ADVANTAGE OF.Definition: to use the good things in a situation

FIGURATIVE.Definition: (of words and phrases) used not with their basic meaning but with a more imaginative meaning, in order to create a special effect

WELL-COMPENSATED.Definition: to pay someone money in exchange for work done, for something lost or damaged, or for some inconvenience

THRIVING.Definition: to grow, develop, or be successful

LAP.Definition: the top surface of the upper part of the legs of a person who is sitting down

SANTA CLAUS.Definition: the imaginary old man with long, white hair and a beard and a red coat who is believed by children to bring them presents at Christmas, or a person who dresses as this character for children

LAPTOP.Definition: a computer that is small enough to be carried around easily and is flat when closed

DIP.Definition: to drive around in a car

LIFE'S A BITCH.Definition: life can be tough, unpleasant, unrewarding

FUCK IT.Definition: an expression of great indifference or nonchalance

TRAGIC.Definition: very sad, often involving death and suffering

AGGRESSIVE.Definition: behaving in an angry and violent way towards another person

OFFENSIVE.Definition: causing someone to feel upset and angry, often because of being rude

BUTTONED UP.Definition: not inclined to reveal thoughts or information; reserved or inhibited

CONTEXT.Definition: the situation within which something exists or happens, and that can help explain it

OVERSTATED.Definition: to describe or explain something in a way that makes it seem more important or serious than it really is
